properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 15 at 3:44PM AKST until February 18 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of
up to 9 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph.
Visibility could fall to one quarter mile or less.

* WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta west of Bethel.

* WHEN...From Sunday evening through late Monday night. The worst
conditions will be from late Sunday night through Monday
morning.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Conditions will deteriorate first with a
front causing visibility to fall to one half mile or less Sunday
evening. Blowing snow reducing visibility to one half mile or
less at times will persist Monday afternoon and Monday night,
though blizzard conditions are not expected after Monday
morning.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a
potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and
extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions
and make travel very hazardous.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT WEST OF BETHEL
